name: actor
description: A special kind of model which can have a scripted motion. This includes both global waypoint type animations and skeleton animations.

children.name: name
children.description: A unique name for the actor.

children.name: skin
children.description: Skin file which defines a visual and the underlying skeleton which moves it.

children.name: filename
children.description: Path to skin file, accepted formats: COLLADA, BVH.

children.name: scale
children.description: Scale the skin's size.

children.name: animation
children.description: Animation file defines an animation for the skeleton in the skin. The skeleton must be compatible with the skin skeleton.

children.name: name
children.description: Unique name for animation.

children.name: filename
children.description: Path to animation file. Accepted formats: COLLADA, BVH.

children.name: scale
children.description: Scale for the animation skeleton.

children.name: interpolate_x
children.description: Set to true so the animation is interpolated on X.

children.name: script
children.description: Adds scripted trajectories to the actor.

children.name: loop
children.description: Set this to true for the script to be repeated in a loop. For a fluid continuous motion, make sure the last waypoint matches the first one.

children.name: delay_start
children.description: This is the time to wait before starting the script. If running in a loop, this time will be waited before starting each cycle.

children.name: auto_start
children.description: Set to true if the animation should start as soon as the simulation starts playing. It is useful to set this to false if the animation should only start playing only when triggered by a plugin, for example.

children.name: trajectory
children.description: The trajectory contains a series of keyframes to be followed.

children.name: id
children.description: Unique id for a trajectory.

children.name: type
children.description: If it matches the type of an animation, they will be played at the same time.

children.name: tension
children.description: The tension of the trajectory spline. The default value of zero equates to a Catmull-Rom spline, which may also cause the animation to overshoot keyframes. A value of one will cause the animation to stick to the keyframes.

children.name: waypoint
children.description: Each point in the trajectory.

children.name: time
children.description: The time in seconds, counted from the beginning of the script, when the pose should be reached.

children.name: pose
children.description: The pose which should be reached at the given time.

children.name: pose
children.description: A pose (translation, rotation) expressed in the frame named by @relative_to. The first three components (x, y, z) represent the position of the element's origin (in the @relative_to frame). The rotation component represents the orientation of the element as either a sequence of Euler rotations (r, p, y), see http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=specify_pose, or as a quaternion (x, y, z, w), where w is the real component.

children.name: relative_to
children.description: If specified, this pose is expressed in the named frame. The named frame must be declared within the same scope (world/model) as the element that has its pose specified by this tag. If missing, the pose is expressed in the frame of the parent XML element of the element that contains the pose. For exceptions to this rule and more details on the default behavior, see http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics. Note that @relative_to merely affects an element's initial pose and does not affect the element's dynamic movement thereafter. New in v1.8: @relative_to may use frames of nested scopes. In this case, the frame is specified using `::` as delimiter to define the scope of the frame, e.g. `nested_model_A::nested_model_B::awesome_frame`.

children.name: rotation_format
children.description: 'euler_rpy' by default. Supported rotation formats are 'euler_rpy', Euler angles representation in roll, pitch, yaw. The pose is expected to have 6 values. 'quat_xyzw', Quaternion representation in x, y, z, w. The pose is expected to have 7 values.

children.name: degrees
children.description: Whether or not the euler angles are in degrees, otherwise they will be interpreted as radians by default.

children.name: link
children.description: A physical link with inertia, collision, and visual properties. A link must be a child of a model, and any number of links may exist in a model.

children.name: joint
children.description: A joint connects two links with kinematic and dynamic properties. By default, the pose of a joint is expressed in the child link frame.

children.name: plugin
children.description: A plugin is a dynamically loaded chunk of code. It can exist as a child of world, model, and sensor.

children.name: name
children.description: A name for the plugin.

children.name: filename
children.description: Name of the shared library to load. If the filename is not a full path name, the file will be searched for in the configuration paths.

children.name: Elements
children.description: Arbitrary elements and attributes that can be used to configure the plugin
